ADGM Compliance Analysis.Purpose: To incorporate a public company limited by shares in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM).
Key Elements: Company Name: [insert proposed company name] (or any other name approved by ADGM Registration Authority)
Incorporation under ADGM Regulations: Explicit statement of incorporation in accordance with ADGM regulations and subordinate rules.
Appointment of Officers: Resolution to appoint officers (Authorised Signatory(ies), Director(s), Secretary(ies)) upon incorporation.
Adoption of Articles of Association: Resolution to adopt Articles of Association for incorporation.
Authorised Share Capital: Resolution specifying the amount of authorised share capital (e.g., [xxxx] USD).
Issued Share Capital: Resolution specifying the proposed issued share capital.
Shareholder Structure: Details of how the issued share capital is structured among shareholders.
Appointment of Signatory for Incorporation: Authorisation of specific individuals to execute documents and complete the incorporation process with the ADGM Registration Authority (RA).
Signatures of Incorporating Shareholders: Evidence of agreement and approval from all incorporating shareholders.
Compliance Considerations: Company Name Approval: Verify that the proposed company name is approved by the ADGM RA.
Articles of Association: Ensure the Articles of Association comply with ADGM Companies Regulations.
Share Capital Requirements: Confirm that the authorised and issued share capital meet the minimum requirements specified by ADGM regulations for public companies.
Officer Appointments: Ensure that the appointed officers meet the eligibility criteria and comply with ADGM requirements for directors, secretaries, and authorised signatories.
Shareholder Information: Accurate and complete disclosure of shareholder information, including ownership percentages.
Authorisation of Signatories: Verify that the authorised signatories have the necessary authority to act on behalf of the company.
Documentation: Ensure all required documents are prepared and submitted in accordance with ADGM RA guidelines.
Regulatory Filings: Timely filing of all necessary documents with the ADGM RA.
AML/KYC Compliance: Compliance with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Customer (KYC) regulations for all shareholders and officers.
Potential Issues: Incomplete or inaccurate information in the resolution or supporting documents.
Failure to obtain necessary approvals from the ADGM RA.
Delays in the incorporation process due to non-compliance issues.
Disputes among shareholders regarding the terms of incorporation.
Recommendations: Consult with legal counsel experienced in ADGM regulations to ensure compliance.
Review all documents carefully before submission to the ADGM RA.
Obtain all necessary approvals and consents in a timely manner.
Maintain accurate records of all transactions and communications related to the incorporation process.
Conduct thorough due diligence on all shareholders and officers to ensure compliance with AML/KYC regulations.
ADGM Compliance Analysis.Template Guidance: This template is suitable for incorporating a public company limited by shares with multiple individual shareholders. Ensure all bracketed placeholders are replaced with accurate information.
